framework
Interface Rule

All Known Implementing Classes:
BriansBrain, GameOfLife, MyRule, RuleAbstract
public interface Rule

The interface defines what the rules written by the client plugin should specify. This ensures that the framework has a consistent set of rules to work with. These methods decide how the next state of a cell is determined.

Author:
Gautham Nagaraju, Victor Dong, Akash Kulkarni, Prakhar Dubey

Method Summary
 Cell getNextCell(Grid g, int x, int y)
          The method that defines the next state of the specified cell.
 Grid getNextGrid(Grid g)
          The method gets the grid with each cell updated to the next state.
 

Method Detail

getNextGrid

Grid getNextGrid(Grid g)
The method gets the grid with each cell updated to the next state.

Parameters:
g - the grid whose next state we want to calculate
Returns:
Grid the grid with all the Cells updated to the next state.

getNextCell

Cell getNextCell(Grid g,
                 int x,
                 int y)
The method that defines the next state of the specified cell.

Parameters:
g - the grid for which we find the next cell's state
x - the column of the cell
y - the row of the cell
Returns:
Cell the next state of the Given cell
